result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew Louis Prudhon was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court orders    3 years initial confinement and 9 months extended supervision in the WI State Prison System. 11:55 a.m.  Defendant Matthew Louis Prudhon in court with attorney Katie J. Christiansen.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15TR1069 to follow.  O'Sullivan calls Pierce County Deputy Allen Wojcik.  Wojcik is sworn and takes the stand.  O'Sullivan examines Wojcik.  Wojcik identifies defendant.  Atty Christiansen cross examines Wojcik.  O'Sullivan redirects.  Atty Christiansen gives argument.  Court addresses the parties.  Court denies Atty. Christiansen's motion to supress.  See JA for pre-trial date.
